After that, it was the same sort of exchange at the supermarket.
The whole thing was so awkward that I don't think I can visit that shopping district for a while.
... Well, I guess you could say that was the cute side of catgirls.

店内に積まれたダンボールへと視線を向ける。

むしろ店内がほぼダンボールになっていた。

reference_answer:
She smiled brightly and brought out the invoice along with a pen.
[Kashou]: 「Okay, let's see...」
I looked over the sales invoice I received once more.
[Kashou]: 「... Somehow, this doesn't look like what I ordered.」
[Tableware Seller]: 「... Huh, is that so?」
[Tableware Seller]: 「Are you saying that these... aren't the correct items?」
[Kashou]: 「No, the stuff I ordered is in here too, but...」
I looked over at the pile of boxes inside the bakery.
Inside of my tiny bakery was a mountain of boxes. A MOUNTAIN.
It was as if the inside of the bakery had become completely made of boxes.
[Kashou]: 「As you can see, we don't need this much tableware inside the bakery...」
[Tableware Seller]: 「I-I'm sorry! I'll check with the main office right away!」
[Tableware Seller]: 「Could you give me a few moments?」
ModelAnswer:

Rechecking the donation slip.
"I... I seem to have received something different than I asked for, but..."
The warehouseman asks...
"Actually, are you sure about it?"
"Um, I think I've received what I asked for," Minaduki Kashou responds with a slight bow.
He turns his gaze to the piled-up cardboard box inside the shop.
A mountain of cardboard boxes piled high within the store.
Even more strikingly, the store itself had become almost entirely made of cardboard.
Minaduki Kashou: "It's clear that here, we don't need so many dishes as elsewhere..."
The salesman: "Oh yes, really?"
"Indeed, it seems I've received the wrong items," Minaduki Kashou continues, his expression unreadable.
He looks at the mountain of boxes.
Minaduki Kashou: "As you see, here we don't require as many utensils as in other places..."

どれも一様に同じ箱なわけで。

[Tableware Seller]: 「So if at all possible, if you would be able to accept this order...」
[Kashou]: 「Accept this order...」
[Kashou]: 「... Huh? From all this?」
The mountain of cardboard boxes towered over everything.
I was at a loss for words.
Every box was of equal size.
I wouldn't know what was inside each of them without opening them up.
On top of that, looking at the sales invoice, I could see that they all contained expensive tea sets and tableware.
And if I accepted it all, it would be a lot of work to deal with all the new items.
[Kashou]: 「Uhm, there's still things that need doing in advance of my bakery's opening, so I don't mind accepting these...」
[Kashou]: 「... but it's going to take a while to deal with all of this.」
ModelAnswer:
Minaduki Kashou: "It seems I accidentally mixed this order with another one..."
"Water Moon Master" suggests: "Master Water Moon."
"I think you might get your order items promptly from here..."
"Perhaps you could receive the order for your item from me then..."
Kashou: "Receiving the order items..."
"...What? From this pile?"
A towering stack of bubble wrap.
My mouth goes dry before I can speak.
They all seem to be in identical boxes.
Not knowing what's inside, I can't open them yet.
Even examining the receipt reveals high-end teaware and dishes.
Therefore, handling with care is crucial, or it'll be disastrous.
Kashou: "Well, it does seem like there's also a bit of opening day preparation..."
"...Isn't that right? "
A mountain of oversized bubble wrap.
My speech breaks mid-sentence.
Everything looks uniform.
I'm unsure what's inside each box.
Opening them would be a lengthy process.
Kashou: "Oh, admittedly, there's also some opening day stuff arriving today..."
"...But from now on, that'll take quite some time..."

[Vanilla]: 「It's a single card that tells you everything about this shop.」

[Kashou]: 「No, that's exactly what business cards are used for.」
She knew about protecting personal information, but not about business cards...?
Well, it was true that it would be a pain if I was in some sort of strange business or something.

Vanilla: "This is something so absurd, it's not even a shop card."
Shoko: "Wow, wow, Master! What's happening? Is this some kind of shop card?"
Personal information protection seems irrelevant in this age. Still, if strange salespeople came, it'd be inconvenient.

Ignoring the lack of awareness about personal information protection, one wouldn't mind if shady salespeople appeared.

[Shigure]: 「... Or is it because I'm naïve to the world?」

reference_answer:
The first thing I saw this morning was so unexpected, my brain couldn't process it all.
[Shigure]: 「Good morning, Nii-sama.」
[Shigure]: 「This recent incident has gotten me thinking...」
She wore a sunny smile that no cloud could cover up.
The catgirls looked at me with similar smiles.
I felt myself break out in a cold sweat...
[Kashou]: 「Haah... thinking... about what...?」
I only managed to get out that much.
[Shigure]: 「After that incident, I learned that there's no way to keep Nii-sama from attempting to achieve the impossible.」
[Shigure]: 「However, it's also a fact that his dear little sister -- namely me -- is losing sleep from worrying about him so much.」
[Shigure]: 「Then, I thought that maybe having more workers would lessen Nii-sama's burden. That was the best plan.」
[Kashou]: 「...... Huh.」
ModelAnswer:
Minaduki Shigure: "Good morning, Brother"
Minaduki Kashou: "I've been thinking a lot about this matter."
A bright, sunny smile absent of clouds.
Even other cats are smiling at me.
As I feel that cold sweat trickling down,
Kashou: "Well... what were you thinking...?"
He manages to keep it mostly out loud.
Shigure: "From this matter, I understand it's not worth putting too much strain on your brother."
However, Shigure also admits, "But I've been worrying about you and my sister all night."
Increasing staff to ease your brother's burden seemed like the best solution, Kashou thought.
Shigure: "The best course of action would be to add more personnel, easing your brother's load..."
Kashou: "…………"

Question:
仕入れ先に頼みたいことがあった。急ぎではないが、早いうちに電話しておいたほうがいい。
個人経営のパティスリーなら普通のことだと思うが、俺は仕入れ先の一つ一つと自分で交渉をしている。
一般流通されていないような食材も、まとまった量を仕入れるなら、売ってくれる農家もある。
味の探究は、食材を探す旅でもあった。
皆が観光で盛り上がっているときに、仕事の話をするのも野暮なので、俺は私用があると言って、部屋を離れる。
念のために旅館からも出て、静かな場所で話すことにした。
電話をかける。
[嘉祥]: 「Bonjour, c'est Kashou Minaduki de La Soleil Japon. Est-ce que je pourrais parler à M. James Carter?」
[嘉祥]: 「ふぅ……」
国外からの注文ということで先方に驚かれたが、どうにか発送してくれそうだ。
俺は旅館の中へと戻る。
reference_answer:
There's something I wanna request from a supplier. It's no rush, but it's a good idea to give him a phone call as soon as possible.
I think it's pretty common for an independently-owned patisserie, but I negotiate with every single supplier on my own.
Even for ingredients not in circulation for the general public, if I need to replenish my supply of them in bulk, there are farmers who will buy it for me.
Researching flavors is also a journey to search for ingredients.
Since it'd be uncouth of me to talk about work when everyone is excited about sightseeing, I tell them that I have personal business to take care of and leave the room.
Just to be sure, I leave the inn and decide to talk someplace quieter.
I make my phone call.
[Kashou]: 「Bonjour, c'est Kashou Minaduki de La Soleil Japon. Est-ce que je pourrais parler à M. James Carter?」
[Kashou]: 「Phew...」
I was met with surprise from the other person on the line since it was an order from overseas, but it seems they'll be putting in my order.
I return to the inn.
ModelAnswer:
Minaduki Kashou: "I wanted to contact a supplier. It's not urgent, but it would be better to do it as soon as possible by phone."
For a patisserie run-of-the-mill business, I think it's normal, but I'm negotiating with each supplier personally.
While ingredients not in general circulation might still be available in bulk from farms willing to sell, they could also be sourced from suppliers I'm directly dealing with.
Exploring flavors was essentially a journey of finding ingredients.
We're all busy during peak tourist season, so discussing work is awkward; I tell myself it's for personal matters and leave early.
For a private conversation, I also ventured out into a ryokan.

[Kashou]: "Hello, this is Kashou Minaduki from La Soleil Japon. Can I speak to Mr. James Carter?"
[Kashou]: "huh..."
Surprised by an order from abroad, but we'll manage to send it off anyway.
I head back inside the ryokan.

Question:
[嘉祥]: 「どれ、１つ食べてみるか」
屋台で温泉まんじゅうを１つ買った。
できたて熱々だ。
かじってみると、ふっくらしていて、思っていたよりしっとりした食感だった。
舌のうえで、ほろほろと餡子が崩れて、甘味が広がる。
[嘉祥]: 「なるほど……ほふほふ……これは、美味しいな」
俺が作る洋菓子も、実家の和菓子も、温かいものを出すということはない。
熱々のまんじゅうを、ほふほふ言いながら食べるのは、これはこれで面白い体験だった。
[嘉祥]: 「そういえば、温泉街には何度か来ているけれど……食べたことなかったな」
昔はネコたちがいなかったからだ。
両親と時雨と俺の４人で旅行しても、買い食いしようなんて話にはならなかった。
reference_answer:
[Kashou]: 「Well then, maybe I should have one.」
I buy a hot-spring manju bun from the stand.
It's freshly made and piping hot.
I take a bite into it, and my mouth is greeted by a fluffy and moist sensation.
Atop my tongue, the red bean paste starts to break down, and the sweetness starts to spread.
[Kashou]: 「Now I see... Fff, Fff... This is pretty good.」
Neither the Western sweets I make nor the Japanese sweets my family makes are ever served warm.
Eating a piping-hot manju bun while huffing to cool it down in my mouth is a pretty interesting experience in its own right.
[Kashou]: 「You know, I've been to the hot spring district plenty of times in the past, but... I never ate one of these before.」
Mostly because the catgirls weren't around back then.
Even when the four of us—my parents, Shigure, and I—traveled, buying local snacks and eating never came into the equation.
ModelAnswer:
Minaduki Kashou: "Just one, hot tea?"
Buying a steaming hot spring mochi from the street stall.
It was hot and freshly made.
Chewing on it, the filling puffed up nicely, more so than I expected.
The sweetness spread across my tongue.
Minaduki Kashou: "Ah, this is delicious."
Making pastries in my own kitchen or traditional sweets from my family doesn't seem possible.
Eating that hot spring mochi, puffing sounds as I did, was a unique experience.
Minaduki Kashou: "By the way, the hot spring town has visited me several times, but... I've never eaten anything like this."
Back then, cats weren't around.
My parents, Minaduki Shigure and Kashou, and four others, including myself, couldn't even manage to buy food like this despite promises of shopping excursions.

[Shigure]: 「...Y-Yes. I apologize for doing it in the middle of our vacation.」
[Kashou]: 「Nothing to apologize over. La Soleil may be on a regular holiday, but it is a weekday by normal standards.」
She never told me the specifics, but Shigure apparently runs a company.
With her income, she's able to buy the catgirls' clothes and allow them to take bell-holder exams, among other things.
My dad is harsh toward me, but he's soft toward my younger sister, Shigure. It seems that he is pretty liberal toward the catgirls and his business.

They'd buy clothes for the kittens there and even give some catmouses the ability to ring bells like a peeperphone.
Father is strict with me, but he's nice to Minaduki's sister. He seems to let the catmouses run their own business.

[Shigure]: 「I was trying to perfectly blend in with the local people.」
[Kashou]: 「Uh, well... Even in Paris, you don't really see people running around with such an aristocratic-looking dress.」
Paris is full of stone-paved roads and you're often climbing stairs, so wearing high-heels is risky. Even the majority of ladies wear sneakers or leather shoes.
Also, most girls wear slim jeans, so girls in skirts are rare.
Their clothes are usually black or white. Mostly anyone wearing beige or patterned outerwear is a tourist.

Question:

reference_answer:
[Fraise]: 「I've always looked up to you... and helped out in the shop because of that.」
[Beignet]: 「Then, once she became the catgirl here, she would always say she wanted to help out around shop and even made her name Fraise.」
[Kashou]: 「If memory serves, a catgirl picks their name when they're three months old, so that's when she came here, huh?」
[Fraise]: 「I know you're really busy right now, so... I decided that I wouldn't say anything about me.」
[Fraise]: 「But now that I've eaten the macaron I've dreamed about... I just couldn't control myself any longer...」
[Shigure]: 「It's fine, Fraise. You needn't contain yourself so badly. Nii-sama understands.」
[Kashou]: 「Yeah, of course. Thank you so much for remembering, Fraise.」
[Kashou]: 「Also, I appreciate you helping out Mentor in such big ways as well.」
ModelAnswer:
Minaduki Kashou: "I was dreaming of being like my older brother...helping out in the shop"
Beignet: "So I kept wanting to be the cat I've been taking care of forever, even naming myself Fraise"
Minaduki Shigure: "Yes, I remember cats usually decide their names around three months old, but it seems so..."
Fraise: "Now, when my brother was having a tough time, I thought I'd never say anything about me."
Fraise (eating macarons): "Then, after eating all those, I couldn't hold it anymore..."
Shigeru: "That's okay, Fraise. You've shown he understands, thank you"
Minaduki Kashou: "Of course. Thank you for remembering that and for helping out so much, Fraise"

[Kashou]: 「Ooh, we've got even more customers than we did yesterday. It's looking a lot like Christmas over here.」
[Shigure]: 「This shop has always been a popular spot among those in the know, but the social media presence seems to have sparked a bigger flame.」
[Kashou]: 「Don't talk like you didn't start it.」
[Shigure]: 「My apologies. I never thought that it would prove this effective.」

[Shigure]: 「You have become the hot topic yourself. Look! Right here, see?」
Shigure holds out her cellphone to reveal a line of comments praising Fraise.
There are even some customers stating they're explicitly coming to see her. Most likely standing in that line outside the shop...
ModelAnswer:

Minaduki Kashou: "Oh... Last night it got even worse, with a huge number of guests. It feels like Christmas..."

Fraise: "That's what I mean."

[Beignet]: 「The reason why I named this shop 'La Soleil' is because of my son's words.」

It fills me with joy to finally find out the origin behind the name La Soleil.
However, this story doesn't seem to be leading toward a happy ever after.

[Beignet]: 「Yes, that goes without saying.」
[Beignet]: 「However, I was forced to leave Japan.」

But it seemed like more than just happiness..."
